channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 14 hours of bbq in metal barrels in front of our house, 8th August
item.description:
Reported this issue countless times but nothing is being done about it. Non residents started fire before 6am this morning and it’s still ongoing with no sign of stopping. We were woken up by the all too familiar smoke, smell of burnt meat and noise again

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wick Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 15 Ivor Street, 8th August
item.description:
This is a hazard that needs immediate attention. My father stepped into the hole and cut his leg. There was a plank of wood nearby that he placed on top of the hole to cover it, but this needs to have a permanent cover.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Ivor Street, Kentish Town, London

item.title: Crowd gatherings blocking traffic view, 8th August
item.description:
As previously reported a large crowd is gathered at the junction corner as per photographs. This is an accident waiting to happen as the crowd is inadvertently obscuring visibility at the junction of traffic coming from the right. I did raise this in a brief conversation with the manager of the coffee shop who did agree that some of the crowd were prejudicing safety by blocking traffic visibility but he stated that he had the support of the council I think that the crowd needs to migrate around the corner into Clockhouse road There must've been around 50 drinkers gathered there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rats in Churchill Gardens, Bromley., 8th August
item.description:
